primair_narratief_programma.beschrijving: The Lamb (Christ) is found worthy to open the sealed book of human deliverance because of His sacrificial suffering (scars), establishing a cosmic pattern where wounding is the prerequisite for spiritual power.

tekstueel_bewijs: He strode to the throne and took the book.
Thou art worthy... for thou wast slain.

object.identificatie: The opening of the seals / Deliverance of humanity
tekstueel_bewijs: the key to the conquering of Satan and necessary to the deliverance of humanity from the captivity of sin

zender.identificatie: Divine Necessity / The Throne of God
tekstueel_bewijs: the solemn drama of divine mystery

ontvanger.identificatie: Humanity / The Wretched Blundering Children of Earth
tekstueel_bewijs: deliverance of humanity from the captivity of sin
ontvanger.positie_hoorder: The hearer identifies as the Receiver of Christ's act, but is quickly transitioned to a Subject role.

helper.identificatie: The Scars / The Act of being Slain
helper.rol_van_god: God (as Lamb) is Subject; the suffering is the instrumental Helper.

tegenstander.toelichting_ernst: The text identifies sin as a 'captivity' and Satan as a foe requiring a 'worthy' opener of seals.

secundair_narratief_programma.beschrijving: The believer must accept their own wounds and risks to gain the 'power' to serve others.
secundair_narratief_programma.subject: The Hearer / The 'Wounded Soldier'
secundair_narratief_programma.object: Spiritual power / Stature God intended / Healing others
secundair_narratief_programma.toelichting_verhouding: The sermon uses Christ's work as a template (exemplarism) for the hearer's own empowerment through suffering.

voorbeelden_god_subject: He strode to the throne and took the book.
Thou wast slain, and hast redeemed us.
voorbeelden_mens_subject: We go through life trying to avoid all situations.
You and I will never come to the stature God intended us to have unless we do get some scars.
I bet my life there is a God.

voorbeelden: the first thing you ought to do
It is natural for us to want to avoid pain.
I would like a life like that. Wouldn't you?
We are not told what the book means.
The one who is able to open the book.

modale_analyse.modale_interpretatie: The sermon focuses on the acquisition of 'Power' (competence). It suggests that power is not a gift of grace but a result of the 'slaying' of the self or the endurance of pain.

semiotisch_vierkant_analyse.beweging_in_preek: Moves from the 'Safety' of the hearer (~S1) to the 'Woundedness' of the Lamb (S1), then demands the hearer move to S1 by accepting their own S2.
semiotisch_vierkant_analyse.theologische_resolutie: Suffering is the currency that buys the ability to heal.
semiotisch_vierkant_analyse.ernst_van_s2: Moderate; S2 is seen more as 'uselessness' or 'stagnation' than eternal judgment.

diagnostische_evaluatie.classificatie_toelichting: While the sermon starts with a strong Christocentric narrative (Rev 5), it quickly pivots to a 'theology of the cross' applied as a moral/psychological principle for human self-actualization.

indicatoren_moralisme.tekstueel_bewijs: You and I will never come to the stature God intended us to have unless we do get some scars.
I believe you, Father, can get more glory out of my life since the scar has come.

indicatoren_genade.tekstueel_bewijs: Thou art worthy... for thou wast slain, and hast redeemed us.

exemplarisme_check.beschrijving: Christ's wounds are not just for our salvation, but are the 'model' for how we must be wounded to be useful.
exemplarisme_check.alternatieve_lezing: Christ's wounds are unique and sufficient; our healing of others is a fruit of His power, not our own scars.

identificatie_patroon.effect_op_hoorder: Pressure to find value in trauma and a 'call to risk' to achieve spiritual status.
identificatie_patroon.theologische_implicatie: Synergism: God provides the pattern, but man must provide the 'risk' and the 'broken heart' to activate the power.

narratieve_coherentie.coherentie_beschrijving: The transition from the cosmic drama of Revelation to the personal psychology of the hearer is smooth but structurally shifts the Subject from Christ to the Hearer.
spanning_punten: The 'deliverance from sin' (Program 1) is replaced by 'making people feel better' (Program 2).

soteriologie.tekstueel_bewijs: In love's service only wounded soldiers can serve.

pneumatologie.competentie_schenking: The 'endowment' comes from the scar itself, not the Holy Spirit.

hamartologie.ernst_diagnose: High in the intro, but fades into 'avoiding pain' in the application.

aanbevelingen.actantiele_audit_samenvatting: The sermon begins with God as Subject (The Lamb) but ends with the Hearer as the Subject who must 'risk grandly' to earn 'spiritual power.'

subject_herpositionering.huidige_probleem: The hearer is told they must be wounded to have power.
subject_herpositionering.voorgestelde_herpositionering: Make Christ's wounds the sole source of power which is then *given* to the hearer.
subject_herpositionering.voorbeeld_revisie: Because Christ was wounded, He now pours His healing power through you, regardless of your own perceived 'stature'.

identificatie_herstel.problematische_identificatie: Hearer as 'Wounded Soldier' earning service stripes.
identificatie_herstel.voorgestelde_identificatie: Hearer as the 'Wretched Blundering Child' who is served by the Lamb.
identificatie_herstel.strategie: Emphasize that we are the ones being healed before we are the ones helping.

modale_balans.voorgestelde_balans: Increase DEVOIR (as a response to grace) and POUVOIR (as a gift of the Spirit).
modale_balans.concrete_suggestie: Focus on the Spirit as the one who gives 'Savoir-faire' (knowing how to help) rather than the scar itself.

tegenstander_intensivering.voorgestelde_intensivering: Re-link the opponent to the 'Satan' and 'Sin' mentioned in the Revelation section.
tegenstander_intensivering.theologische_rationale: If the opponent is just 'coyness,' the solution is just 'bravery' (moralism).

narratieve_hierarchie_herstel.probleem: The secondary program (our service) overshadows the primary (Christ's redemption).
narratieve_hierarchie_herstel.voorgestelde_structuur: Christ's worthiness is the *only* reason the book opens; our service is a 'new song' we sing in response, not a secondary seal-breaking.

aanbevelingen.slotopmerking: The sermon has a powerful rhetorical hook and a strong start in the text, but it risks turning the Gospel into a 'self-help via suffering' manual. Re-centering the active verbs on the Lamb would transform this from a call to 'heroic wounding' into a proclamation of 'sufficient grace'.

comparatieve_analyse.verschil_met_retorische_analyse: A rhetorical analysis would praise the Wilder illustration; Greimas reveals that the illustration actually displaces Christ as the unique Subject.
comparatieve_analyse.verschil_met_exegese: Exegesis explains the seals; Greimas shows that the sermon uses the seals as a metaphor for human potential.
comparatieve_analyse.unieke_inzichten_greimas: Greimas exposes the 'Subject-switch' at the midpoint where the hearer takes over the Lamb's role of 'earning' power through slaying.

appendices.notities: The sermon leans heavily on the 'Wounded Healer' archetype (Jungian/Nouwen), which often struggles with Greimasian Subject-consistency in a strictly theocentric framework.
